proposals.reasoning: This team threads the needle between the main suggestions so far. Most players have treated Bob and Grace as the safest early core, and multiple people (Bob, Charlie, Diana, Frank, and I) have been open to testing me on mission one as the third without centering the more controversial picks like Alice. Choosing Bob–Grace–Eve respects the emerging consensus around Bob and Grace while keeping the team close to what several people already discussed, giving us a clean first probe without overhauling the table’s existing logic.

votes.comment: Eve is a teammate, so this gives us a chance to sabotage early while the table largely trusts the lineup.
Too risky to put both Grace and Eve on the first mission, especially with Eve self-including; I’d rather test a Bob–Grace–Diana style team first.

This matches the team I advocated (Bob–Grace–Eve) and avoids the most controversial pick, Alice. Mission 1 is mostly informational, and this lineup reflects the broad early consensus while keeping my stated preferences consistent.
This matches what I advocated earlier (Bob–Grace–Eve) as a solid info-gathering first test built around the most widely trusted pair so far.
As evil, I want to be on the early team to influence outcomes and information; this lineup is widely accepted and keeps me in the mix.
This matches my earlier support for testing Bob–Grace–Eve; mission 1 is mostly informational, and this team aligns with the emerging cautious consensus without including the main controversy (Alice).
I’d rather start with the quieter Bob–Grace–Diana/Frank structure we were circling around than lock in Eve, who was pushed onto the team more by early momentum than by any clear logic.
Bob–Grace core is fine, but I’d rather test a quieter third like Diana or Frank than lock in Eve, whose slot feels more momentum-driven than logically justified.
Eve is evil and on the team, so this lineup benefits us while still looking like a consensus-based, reasonable first mission test.

discussion.content: For a first mission we should keep it simple and pick people who haven’t drawn any heat yet — something like me, Bob, and Diana feels reasonably safe. We’ll get useful information from the result without overthinking patterns this early.

I’m a bit wary of anyone volunteering themselves this early, so I’d rather see at least one of Grace or Eve on the first team since they both give me a slightly better vibe right now. Maybe something like Alice, Grace, and Bob or swap me for Eve if people prefer.

Early teams are mostly guesses, but I’m a bit uneasy about Alice pushing herself onto the first mission right away. I’d rather see a mix like Grace, Eve, and Bob so we spread trust around without giving too much control to the people proposing themselves.

I’m also a bit cautious about Alice pushing to be on the first team, so I’d lean toward something like Bob, Grace, and Eve for mission one. That gives us a cleaner read without centering the people most eager to go.

I’m pretty aligned with the Bob–Grace–Eve idea for mission one since it spreads things out without leaning too hard on the people pushing to go. If folks really don’t like that, I’d only swap one person at most rather than rebuilding the whole team.

I’m happy anchoring the first mission around Bob and Grace since they’ve both felt relatively measured so far, but I’d rather avoid Alice on mission one given how quickly she pushed herself onto a team. If we keep Eve as the third, I’m okay with Bob–Grace–Eve as a starting test.

I like anchoring around Bob and I’m happy to go, but I’d rather not lock in Eve by default just because her name caught momentum early. Something like Bob–me–Diana or Bob–me–Frank feels like a cleaner first probe.

I’m comfortable treating Bob and Grace as our starting core for now, and I’d rather round it out with someone who hasn’t been pushed as hard—like Diana or Frank—so we’re not just following the loudest early momentum.

Given how fast opinions crystallized around certain names, I’d rather lean into the quieter consensus of Bob–Grace–Diana for mission one, since it balances the early caution around Alice and doesn’t lock us into Eve just because her name snowballed. If that team comes back clean, we can start building a real trust core from there.

proposals.reasoning: Bob and Grace are mildly trusted after the clean first mission, and many players have expressed preference for exactly two of {Bob, Grace, Eve} to avoid all three coasting on a single success. I’m choosing Bob + Grace rather than repeating Eve to test whether the first clean mission was due to their alignment or Eve’s. Alice is widely suggested and generally trusted so far, giving us a strong new info point. I include myself (Frank) instead of a fourth completely new player like Charlie/Diana both because I know I’m good and because several people already floated me as an acceptable swap option, which should keep broad support while still expanding the information pool and not hard-locking any single trio.

votes.comment: Team fits the widely supported structure with two from the first mission plus two new, and I like being able to get more info on Frank while keeping Bob/Grace continuity.
Keeps continuity with the clean first mission via me and Grace while adding two new players for info; composition matches what many have been pushing for and doesn’t look overly risky yet.
Matches my preferred structure of exactly two from {Bob, Grace, Eve} plus two new players; solid info-gathering team without over-committing to the first mission trio.

Fits the agreed structure of exactly two from {Bob, Grace, Eve} plus two new; I’d have preferred Charlie over Frank for info, but this is still a reasonable, informative team to test Bob/Grace further.

Team has only one mission of info so far and includes both Bob and Grace from the clean first mission plus Alice, who’s broadly trusted; swapping in Frank instead of Charlie is within the consensus structure and still gives useful alignment info, so I’m fine backing this.
Bob/Grace are mildly trusted from the clean first mission, I know I’m good, and Alice is broadly town-leaning; this is a reasonable high-success, high-info team for Mission 2.
Solid team with two mildly trusted from M1 and two new players; no known red flags, and it gives good alignment info without over-committing to any trio.
Team fits the widely supported structure of exactly two from {Bob, Grace, Eve} plus two new players, and there are no strong red flags yet—this is a reasonable info-gathering lineup for Mission 2.
Team includes an evil ally (Alice) while looking very reasonable to the table, so letting this go through is good for us.

discussion.content: Bob and Grace look pretty clean after that first mission, so I’d like to see at least one of them on the team, but we should be careful about throwing too many completely new players in at once.

I agree we should keep some continuity from the first team—having at least one of me/Grace/Eve on the mission seems smart—but I’d rather not repeat the exact same trio so we can start getting info on a couple of new players too. Maybe anchor the team with one or two of us from Mission 1 and fill the rest with people who’ve been more transparently pro-good in their voting so far.

I’m okay treating Bob/Grace/Eve as mildly town-leaning for now, but a clean first mission doesn’t clear all three, so I’d like a team with exactly two of them plus two new people so we get info without handing spies an easy pass.

I like the idea of exactly two from {Bob, Grace, Eve} plus two fresh faces—right now I’m leaning Bob + Grace with, say, Alice and Charlie, so we both keep some proven coverage and start getting real info on new people.

I’m fine with the “exactly two of {Bob, Grace, Eve}” idea, but I’d actually rather keep myself on as known quantity alongside Bob and then add, say, Alice and Charlie so we’re not over-committing to the same pair while still expanding our info pool.

I’m good with the “exactly two of {Bob, Grace, Eve}” approach, but I’d slightly prefer Bob + Grace plus two new people (probably Alice and Charlie) so we don’t let Eve coast on being leader of the first clean mission.

I’m on board with the “exactly two of {Bob, Grace, Eve}” idea, and right now I’d most like to see something like Bob + me + Alice + Charlie, or swap Charlie for Diana/Frank if people are more comfortable with that mix.

I like the “exactly two of {Bob, Grace, Eve}” plan, and right now Bob + Grace plus two new people feels best—Alice + Charlie works for me, but I’d also be okay swapping one of them for Diana if people are uneasy.

I like the “exactly two of {Bob, Grace, Eve}” structure, but I’d actually prefer Bob + Eve + Alice + Charlie so we’re not hard-locking Bob/Grace as a permanent pair this early. That way we keep continuity from the clean mission while still spreading the information net a bit wider.

proposals.reasoning: We need a mostly fresh team that avoids the exact mix that caused Mission 2 to fail while not auto-building around any single player. This lineup benches both Alice and Frank, who were the only new additions on the failing Mission 2 team, and also steps away from locking in Eve as a permanent core member, which several of us (including me) were wary of. Charlie, Diana, and Henry have not yet been on a mission, so this combination gives us a clean read on a new block of players while only reusing one person from the failed team (me), reducing overlap with previous missions and helping us isolate where the earlier fail came from if anything goes wrong.

votes.comment: This lineup sidelines both Bob and Eve—our only tested cores—while keeping Grace from the failed Mission 2, so if this fails we still won’t meaningfully narrow down where the earlier fail came from. I’d rather include at least one of Bob/Eve alongside the new faces for better info.
Grace pushing to sideline Eve and now centering a team on herself looks more like Morgana than Merlin; I don’t want a mission anchored by someone I strongly suspect is evil.

Grace was on both earlier teams including the failed one, and this lineup omits Eve, who is our only member from a clean mission and absent from the fail; I’d rather build around Eve plus fresh faces than center the one overlapping player from the failure.

Grace is in the main suspect pool from Mission 2, and this team has three totally untested players plus that suspect; I’d rather build around Eve and mostly fresh faces with at most one of Bob/Grace to better isolate the Mission 2 fail.
Mostly fresh team with only one overlap from the failed mission, gives us new info while not auto-locking Eve as core.

Grace is in the small suspect pool from the failed Mission 2, and this team also omits more trusted structure around Eve; I’d rather see a team like Eve+Charlie+two of Diana/Henry/Iris with none of Bob/Grace/Alice than anchor a mission on Grace plus three unknowns.
I like that this avoids both Eve and Frank while giving us a mostly fresh group with only one overlap from the failed Mission 2, which should give a clearer read if anything goes wrong.
I wanted a team built around Eve plus mostly fresh faces; this lineup instead benches Eve and includes Grace from the suspicious Mission 2 set, which feels riskier than necessary.
This matches the ‘mostly fresh faces’ approach I wanted, reuses only one player from the failed mission, and keeps Bob off while only including one of Bob/Grace.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 2’s failure implicates the set {Bob, Grace, Alice, Frank}, since they were the ones overlapping or newly added to the failing team. To maximize the chance of a clean mission while gathering info, I’m building around Eve (from the successful Mission 1) plus mostly fresh faces who weren’t on the failing team. This team—Eve, Charlie, Diana, and myself (Henry)—completely avoids Alice and Frank (the only new additions to the failed Mission 2) and also excludes both Bob and Grace for this round, so we’re not reusing the suspicious core. This aligns with the majority’s stated preference for “Eve + Charlie + two of Diana/Henry/Iris” and should give us a high-probability good team while clearly separating the Mission 2 suspects from this test group.

votes.comment: Eve is on the team, giving evil a chance to sabotage while keeping most heat on the previous mission’s suspects.
Strongly aligned with the table’s consensus to test an Eve-centered team with mostly fresh faces and exclude the full Mission 2 suspect set; good info gain and good chances of a clean run.

This team fully avoids the main suspect set from the failed Mission 2 (Bob, Grace, Alice, Frank) and matches the earlier consensus of Eve + me + two of Diana/Henry/Iris, so it’s our safest, most informative option right now.

Team avoids all four main Mission 2 suspects (Bob, Grace, Alice, Frank) and matches my earlier preference for Eve + mostly fresh faces; as a good player, this is currently the safest structural choice.
I’m on the team, only one fail is needed, and the composition is widely palatable so it should pass the table easily.

This cleanly avoids the entire {Bob, Grace, Alice, Frank} pool implicated by the failed Mission 2 and matches the broadly supported ‘Eve + Charlie + two of Diana/Henry/Iris’ structure, giving a good chance of a clean team and strong info even if it fails.

I still don’t like hard-centering teams on Eve when we’ve only seen a single 3-player success; I’d rather avoid treating anyone as an auto-include and prefer a configuration that doesn’t hinge on her.

Team fully avoids the Mission 2 suspect set {Bob, Grace, Alice, Frank} I distrusted earlier and matches the Eve+Charlie+two-fresh-faces structure I advocated, giving a strong chance at a clean mission and good info.
Team matches the earlier consensus I supported (Eve + Charlie + two of Diana/Henry/Iris) and fully avoids the Mission 2 suspects, so it looks like a solid test lineup.

discussion.content: With mission 2 failing, I really don’t like repeating that core; I’d prefer at most one of Bob/Grace/Frank on the next team, ideally Bob plus some fresh faces.

I still feel best about reusing the Mission 1 core that actually passed, so I’d like at least one of Eve/Grace on the team, but I’m also okay rotating off myself if that helps narrow down which of Alice/Frank/Grace caused the fail last round.

I’m not happy reusing much of that last team—if we can, I’d like Eve plus mostly new faces (something like Eve + me + two of Diana/Henry/Iris) and at most one of Bob/Grace to narrow down where the fail came from.

I like Charlie’s idea of building around Eve with mostly new faces—something like Eve + me + Charlie + one of Henry/Iris—so we only include at most one of Bob/Grace/Frank/Alice to narrow down where that fail came from.

I’m on board with building around me plus mostly new faces—something like me, Charlie, and two of Diana/Henry/Iris—while benching both Alice and Frank for a round so we can see if things stabilize without either of the new additions from the failed mission.

Given Mission 2’s fail and knowing I’m clean, I’m happy to sit this one out so we can test a mostly new group built around Eve plus Charlie and two of Diana/Henry/Iris. I’d prefer we take at most one of Bob/Grace/Alice this round to really narrow down where that fail came from.

I’m a bit wary of locking the team around any one person, especially when Mission 1 was such a small sample, so I’d rather we don’t treat Eve as an automatic include. I’d be more comfortable with something like Bob plus a mix from Charlie/Diana/Henry, and rotate both Eve and Frank off for now.

I like the idea of a mostly fresh team built around Eve and Charlie with two of Diana/Iris/me, and at most one of Bob/Grace so we can pinpoint where that Mission 2 fail came from. I’d lean toward excluding both Alice and Frank this round since they were the only new additions to the failing team.

I’m broadly on board with the “Eve + mostly fresh faces” idea, but I’d really like to see at most one of Bob/Grace on this team so we can separate the Mission 1 core from whatever went wrong on Mission 2.

proposals.reasoning: This lineup keeps Eve off the mission, which is the main consensus concern after both failed missions, and also leaves Henry out, which fits the worries several of us voiced about reusing too much of the last team and specifically Henry’s role in M3. It avoids recreating either previous failed team while still using players many have been leaning town on (Alice, Bob, Charlie, Diana). As leader I’m including myself rather than stacking more of the heavily scrutinized M2 group (Grace/Frank), giving a mixed team that fits the single-fail pattern analysis without overusing any one previous combination.

votes.comment: Keeps both Eve and Henry off after the single-fail pattern on M2/M3, uses a mostly trusted core, and brings in Iris as a fresh slot without recreating previous failed combos.
Too many slots from both suspected groups (Alice plus Charlie/Diana) while excluding Grace, who I’m more confident in, and adding largely untested Iris on a must-succeed mission.
Keeps my top suspects Eve and Henry off, avoids reusing the full failed M2/M3 teams, and only includes two from the M2 suspect pool plus me, which feels like a reasonable risk for this mission.

Must-succeed mission and this team has two members from the M2 fail set (Alice/Bob) plus an untested Iris; I’d rather limit M2 representation to at most one and build around (me, Charlie, Henry) while keeping Eve off.
Two of my evil teammates are on this team, and keeping suspicion focused on Eve and Henry benefits us.

Team includes two from {Alice,Bob} and two from {Charlie,Diana}, which are exactly the two suspect pools from the failed missions; from my perspective that almost certainly stacks multiple evils on this mission.

I don’t like that this team has neither Grace nor Frank after both were central to earlier info, and it leans heavily on relatively untested players instead of a more mixed lineup from prior missions.

From my POV as Henry I know I’m good, and this team both excludes me and still pulls from both suspect pools (M2: Alice/Bob and M3: Charlie/Diana) plus an untested Iris. I’d rather back a lineup that includes me and trims at least one of those risk clusters.
Two evils (including me) are on this team; passing it gives us a strong chance to secure the third failed mission.

proposals.reasoning: This team keeps Eve off after she was on both failed missions, avoids recreating either full M2 (Bob/Grace/Alice/Frank) or M3 (Eve/Charlie/Diana/Henry), and aligns with several suggested patterns: mixing mostly from Alice/Bob/Charlie/Diana/Grace while not over‑stacking the exact previous failure combos. Bob, Charlie, Diana, and Grace have all been floated as relatively trustworthy by multiple players, and adding Alice maintains a strong overlap with the broadly agreed safe pool while still giving us a fresh configuration for this crucial mission.

votes.comment: Keeps Eve off after both fails, avoids recreating earlier failed teams, and uses a broadly agreed-on core of relatively trusted players in a new configuration.

Keeps Eve, Henry, and Frank (my main suspect from M2) off the team, aligns with Grace’s preferred pool, and it’s plausible this lineup is all good given my knowledge that Grace and I are both good and the M2 fail could be on Frank instead of Alice.

This team stacks three players from the failed M2 (Alice/Bob/Grace) plus Diana from the failed M3. Given at least one evil in each of those failure groups, it’s too likely we’re loading multiple evils onto a must‑succeed mission.

This stacks three players from the M2 suspect pool (Alice/Bob/Grace/Frank) plus Charlie from the M3 suspect set, so it’s very likely to contain at least two evils; Iris’s earlier proposal was safer than this configuration.
Keeps me off after two failed missions I was on, fits the single-fail pattern logic, and closely matches the Alice+Charlie+Diana+Bob/Grace mix I was already advocating.

This team must contain at least two evils: exactly one of Alice/Bob/Grace is evil from M2’s single fail, and exactly one of Charlie/Diana/Henry/Eve is evil from M3’s single fail—this team includes all three of Alice/Bob/Grace plus both Charlie and Diana, so it’s almost guaranteed to fail.
Keeps Eve and Iris off, avoids recreating M2/M3, and uses a widely trusted core of Alice/Bob/Charlie/Diana with just one repeat from the M2 fail configuration.

I know I’m good, so from M3 there must be at least one evil among Eve/Charlie/Diana; with Eve off, that means at least one of Charlie/Diana is evil, so this team is guaranteed to include at least one evil and possibly more from the M2 group as well.
Keeps Eve and Henry off as I wanted, uses the main ‘trusted pool’ others have been circling around, and we need to see a new mix rather than stalling on proposals.

discussion.content: Given the info so far, Eve’s the only one who’s been on both failed missions, so I really don’t want her on this team, and I’d also be cautious about stacking too many of Bob/Grace/Frank together again. I’d feel better with a mix from Charlie/Diana/Henry plus one of Bob/Grace/Frank, but not Eve.

I agree Eve is too risky to include again right now, but we shouldn’t forget there’s also at least one evil in the M2 group, so I’d like a team that’s something like Grace plus a mix from Charlie/Diana/Henry and maybe Alice, without stacking the same combos we’ve already seen.

From my perspective there’s definitely at least one evil among Eve/Diana/Henry from last round, and Eve’s the common factor with both fails, so I’d really like a team that keeps Eve off and mixes mostly from Alice/Bob/Grace/Frank plus me, without re‑stacking the full M2 lineup.

Given both fails, I really don’t want Eve back on the team, and from my side I know I’m good, so I’d like a lineup something like Alice + me + 2–3 from Bob/Grace/Charlie/Henry, but not recreating either full M2 or M3.

If everyone’s set on keeping me off, then we should at least use the info we have: with only one fail on each of M2 and M3, there’s exactly one evil in Bob/Grace/Alice/Frank and exactly one in Charlie/Diana/Henry, and from my side Henry’s late approve on the second M3 proposal pings me more than anyone else right now. So a team like Alice + Diana + two from Bob/Grace/Frank (but not recreating M2) plus Charlie feels like a reasonable compromise.

From my point of view there’s exactly one evil in {Bob, Grace, Alice} since I know I’m good, plus at least one in {Eve, Charlie, Diana, Henry}, and with Eve on both failed teams I really want a lineup like Alice + me + two from Bob/Charlie/Diana + one of Grace/Henry, but definitely no Eve and not recreating M2 or M3.

Given the two single‑fail missions, I’d really like to keep Eve off this one and lean on people who’ve mostly been reading clean so far, like something drawn from Alice/Bob/Charlie/Diana/Frank rather than reusing the exact M2 or M3 combos. Iris and Henry are still pretty untested in missions, so I’d rather not rely on them both at once on such a crucial round.

Given the single-fail pattern, I really don’t want Eve back on, and from my side I’d feel best with something like Alice + me + Charlie + Diana plus just one of Bob/Grace/Frank so we’re not stacking too many from that earlier fail.

Given the single‑fail pattern, I’m most wary of reusing too many people from M2 and especially Henry from the M3 group, so I’d be happier with something like Alice + Bob + Charlie + Diana + one of Grace/Frank, keeping Eve and Henry both off this round.
